message.content:
We can tell you that when we try to “link‐up” Doris with Edward it turns out that although each is placed in an extensive family network, no chain of “ancestor–descendant” relationships connects Doris to Edward in any way that makes one either an ancestor or descendant of the other—or even one with a common descendant. (For example, we have the fact “Doris is Jeremy’s descendant” along with several links above her (such as Jeremy being Mary’s descendant, Mary having an ancestor Benjamin, and even further back, Megan being Benjamin’s ancestor). Meanwhile, for Edward the only information is that “Michael is Edward’s ancestor” (and Michael in turn has an ancestor, namely Frances, whose ancestor is Aaron, and so on). Although each network is quite long, no piece of the chain from Doris’ side meets any piece of Edward’s chain.) 

Since:
 • Doris is not an ancestor of Edward,
 • Doris is not a descendant of Edward,
 • They do not share any given descendant,
 • And there is no evidence given that they have any common ancestor in the provided relationships,
the correct choice is that none of the above listed options is correct.

<ANSWER>5</ANSWER>
